1753888-backend-engineer-infura.title: Backend Engineer (Infura)
1753888-backend-engineer-infura.description:
About ConsenSys

At ConsenSys we have a vision of a world where data sovereignty and financial well-being is accessible to every person and organization. We believe Ethereum and decentralized protocol technology is a more trustworthy and equitable foundation for how we create and share value across the web. On this trusted, open source foundation, we can accelerate the world’s transition to a universally accessible network of distributed participants where transparency, security and freedom are fundamental.

Our product suite, composed of Truffle, Infura, Quorum, Codefi, MetaMask, and Diligence, serves millions of users, supports billions of blockchain-based queries for our clients, and has handled billions of dollars in digital assets. As the leading Ethereum software company, ConsenSys enables developers, enterprises, and people worldwide to build next-generation applications, launch modern financial infrastructure, and access the decentralized web. To learn more about ConsenSys, and explore our products and solutions, visit http://consensys.net/.

Why join ConsenSys?

Remote first. You’ll be joining a team based all over the world. Providing the unique opportunity to work with people from many different countries and cultures. Want to work remotely? Go ahead. Or pop into one of our offices? We’ve got you covered in NYC, DC, Dublin, London, Paris, Brisbane and Hong Kong.

Flexible working arrangements. You can create your own journey with flexible schedules and locations. We believe everyone has the right to control their own freedom. Our people can make their own schedule, own their own time, and we encourage you to travel and work from anywhere in the world.

Continuous learning and opportunities. You’ll be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas and frameworks from your peers and as you work on different projects — challenging you to stay at the top of your game. To support your development we pay for you to learn by offering unlimited access to Coursera, a platform with thousands of courses for you to learn whatever you want, and acquire new skills.

Unlimited vacation/holidays. We value downtime to recharge and reset ensuring everyone at ConsenSys has work/life balance. Company-wide we participate in “zero productivity” days every quarter to take a break from work, shut down, and sit back and relax.

One of the most recognized tech companies in the blockchain ecosystem globally. Work experience at ConsenSys is a tremendous reference for your future career. You’ll join a network of entrepreneurs and technologists that reaches the edge of our ecosystem.

About Infura

Infura is the leading infrastructure platform providing scalable and easy-to-use APIs and cloud solutions for blockchain and decentralized application developers. Infura currently offers APIs for Ethereum, IPFS, and other leading decentralized networks, allowing developers to immediately begin building instead of spending time on architecting and maintaining their own infrastructure.

Infura provides developers instant access to decentralized and blockchain networks without the need to sync or understand complicated peer to peer infrastructure. Similar to how one might access a cloud service to alleviate the friction of owning proprietary compute and storage, Infura lowers the barrier to entry for engineers to begin building.

We believe in a more equitable and decentralized future, and we know developers will be at the forefront of that progress. We want to empower developers to spend their time building, creating, and evolving by providing them with the best and easiest solution to their infrastructure needs.

Some things to know about the Infura team, we are a remote first company, with team members all over the world. We strive to reduce meetings, respect work life balance, promote diversity, and generally be good people. We depend on each other not only to make an amazing product but to be a group that wants to succeed together.

What you’ll do

Infura delivers blockchain API access at internet scale. Look forward to applying the techniques and scaling tricks you’ve learned over your career to the emerging blockchain technology set. Using GoLang, you will build out system APIs, daemons, and other such microservices to support our high volume APIs and our customer facing frontends. You will analyze and optimize performance in high-traffic internet applications to deliver the best experience to the engineers we serve.

Architect and design systems that provide reliable, scalable access to various blockchains and decentralized networks. Collaborate with an experienced team of senior engineers to build an infrastructure that can service a growing number of developers and projects that are building for the blockchain. The systems you build will be powering the innovation happening in the web3 world.

Would be great if you brought this to the role

Ideally you have 5+ years of experience focussed on backend engineering, systems engineering, or scaling web services.

GoLang is the primary language at Infura and experience with it is preferred, but deep experience with any strongly typed languages supporting concurrency would be sufficient.

Infura works with open source stacks, so direct experience with open source technologies such as Linux, Docker, Redis, RDBMS and NoSQL storage systems.

Experience with distributed systems is a bonus.

A natural curiosity, thirst for knowledge, and interest in diving into blockchain and its complex code bases will help you succeed in this role.

Our most successful engineers have a constant desire to improve, refine, and take things higher.

Great communication and proven abilities to work in a team setting (on premises or fully remote).

Don't meet all the requirements? Don't sweat it. We’re passionate about building a diverse team of humans and as such, if you think you've got what it takes for our remote-friendly, energetic start-up environment—apply anyway. While we have a pretty good idea of what we need, we're ready for you to challenge our thinking on who needs to be in this role. We are simply looking for amazing people who share in our vision for making great things with great people.

ConsenSys is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is made available and accessible to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

ConsenSys is aware of fraudulent recruitment practices and we encourage all applicants to review our best practices to protect yourself which can be found here.

#LI-CB1

paperchain.name: Paperchain
paperchain.content:
Instant payment card and wallet for creators

Paperchain is an instant payment card and wallet for online creators. Paperchain makes it possible to be paid as fast as your content is streamed by simply connecting your streaming channels to your personal Paperchain card. When you stream, you get paid. Spend it, withdraw it, or earn interest on it. No more loans, no more advances or credit cards. Your digital content revenue, paid every day. We were just in Rolling Stone announcing our UnitedMasters partnership. Invested in by Brent Faiyaz. Used by Dibyo, LoQuacious, EmmoLei Sankofa, and many more. Our product is built on a unique stack of data processing, NFTs & web3 finance and a front-end finance app.

1681158-senior-data-engineer.title: senior data engineer
1681158-senior-data-engineer.description:
about the role

You will be responsible for building data products at Paperchain.

You'd be building on what's already in place, re-engineer if need be and setup our data pipeline for reliability and scale.

At the core of our product stack is the ability to ingest and price massive amounts of streaming data from Spotify, Apple, YouTube, etc. Without pricing we can't do instant payments and this role is geared towards iterating and improving our pricing model and data pipeline.

responsibilities

  • Help build and maintain the ETL data pipelines from external sources like Apple, Spotify, YouTube, Google into our data warehouse
  • Engineer our back-end to support a highly scalable distributed data platform
  • Build fast & robust microservice architecture and scale our stack (APIs, Events, Cache, Storage)
  • Automate and optimize manual data accumulation and analytical processes
  • Extend, optimize and maintain our current production ETL pipelines
  • Implement and deploy time-series based forecasting models
  • Write and optimize advanced SQL queries to analyze the media analytics and financial data
  • Extend, optimize and maintain some of our current backend systems
  • Iterate on and optimize our user data model, linking our users to our app stack, their content platforms (eg spotify) and their vendors (eg UnitedMasters)
  • All of your work should be optimized for interoperability with our product API stack
  • Develop data access policies that ensures our user data is accessed and handled in a secure and responsible manner
  • We're in a mode of hyper-growth and want to add to our team as soon as possible
  • If you are in the US / New York City you're welcome to join the CEO and work out of our co-work space

about you

  • Can write high-quality code and well-versed in TypeScript, Python and/or Go
  • Fluent in writing SQL queries
  • Comfortable working using Docker & Kubernetes
  • Well-versed in distributed databases (PostgreSQL) & systems
  • Have advanced knowledge of microservices architecture
  • Able to plan, strategize and implement quickly
  • Can communicate data trends effectively via verbal/nonverbal communication channels (GCP data studio, dashboards, graphs etc.)
  • Have 4+ years experience as a Back-End / Data Engineer or in a similar role

bonus

  • Familiar with Airflow or Data flow
  • Familiar with OLAP systems (like Druid or Clickhouse)
  • Solid understanding of machine learning
  • Understand how to set up a CI/CD pipelines (Google Cloud Build/Github Actions)
  • Personally interested in what's happening in the creator economy (NFTs, crypto, music and media streaming)
  • Passionate or interested in the online content space and web3 finance, in particular, exploring new business models by combining both

1721343-founding-frontend-engineer.title: Founding Frontend Engineer
1721343-founding-frontend-engineer.description:
about the role

We're scaling our engineering team to build new features that our improve our products.

You’ll help solve unique, large scale, highly complex technical problems and build delightful user experiences and scalable frontend systems to make instant payments accessible to every creator in the world.

You'll also work with our security and risk engineering teams to build trust and safety features to protect user accounts, without compromising on the user experience.

If you're excited by the problem space of designing and delivering engaging user experiences, building performant user interfaces, and building trustworthy financial systems, let's talk!

We're in a mode of hyper-growth and want to add to our team as soon as possible

If you are in the US / New York City you're welcome to join the CEO and work out of our co-work space.

responsibilities

  • Articulate a long term technical direction and vision for maintaining and scaling our web and mobile platforms
  • Create wonderful UX by building interfaces that are simple, easy to comprehend, performant and reliable using modern tools like React, React Native, Typescript, React Navigation, Jest and Webpack
  • Work with CEO, CTO and the backend team to prioritize and ship user stories at a rapid pace
  • We want you to bring your best practice design techniques and coding standards to lay the foundation for the Paperchain wallet experience
  • Make your coworkers feel included in every interaction.
  • All of your work should be optimized for interoperability with our product API stack

about you

  • You have at least 5 years of experience in software engineering and at least 4 years of experience in developing web apps and shipping user-facing features with JavaScript and modern, component-based JS frameworks like React.
  • You've developed and shipped user-facing features using component-based UI frameworks.
  • You’re familiar with current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, security and usability.
  • You’re familiar with product and design lifecycles, and collaborating closely with designers, engineers, and product managers.
  • You write high quality, well tested code to meet the needs of your customers.

bonus

  • You've worked on front-end teams in the finance or security space
  • You have at least 1 year of experience in developing React Native mobile apps or helped move existing native apps to React Native
  • Personally interested in what's happening in the creator economy (NFTs, crypto, music and media streaming)
  • Passionate or interested in the online content space and web3 finance, in particular, exploring new product experiences for creators by combining both

1701392-lead-machine-learning-engineer.title: Lead Machine Learning Engineer
1701392-lead-machine-learning-engineer.description:
about the role

At the core of our product is the ability to predict the per unit pay rate for streaming content (how much to pay) and tell our banking app to send those funds into the user wallet (who to pay).

We're looking for a machine learning engineer to 100x our data capabilities. What does that mean? For us the key question is, how do we support 10,000 users? 100,000?

You'd be building on what's already in place, re-engineer if need be and setup our data processes for reliability and scale.

At the core of our product stack is the ability to ingest and price massive amounts of streaming data from Spotify, Apple, YouTube, etc. Without pricing we can't do instant payments and this role is geared towards iterating and improving our pricing model and data pipeline.

responsibilities

  • Maintain and iterate on our current time-series based learning model to accurately predict the per unit payout rate for streaming content
  • Iterate on and optimize our user data model, linking our users to our app stack, their content platforms (eg spotify) and their vendors (eg UnitedMasters)
  • All of your work should be optimized for interoperability with our product API stack
  • Write and optimize SQL queries to analyze media performance analytics and financial data
  • Work with engineering to help build fast & robust micro-services and scale our stack (APIs, Events, Cache, Storage) with processes that will help preset data to our users in our web and mobile applications
  • Make decisions regarding tools and languages used in our data engineering and analytics stack
  • Architect and support the build of our data pipeline to ensure data integrity and performance uptime
  • Work with CEO and Growth team to ideate and develop different data analytics projects surrounding creator income, payments, NFT analytics, user engagement analysis etc.
  • Develop data access policies that ensures our user data is accessed and handled in a secure and responsible manner
  • Build self-service business intelligence & reporting capabilities using technologies such PostgreSQL, GCP and more
  • Create plans surrounding standardizing our data pipelines, processes and how data is handled
  • We're in a mode of hyper-growth and want to add to your team as soon as possible
  • If you are in the US / New York City you're welcome to join the CEO and work out of our co-work space

about you

  • Have worked with data intensive projects that require rapid iteration and deployment
  • Built and deployed machine learning models
  • Have successfully held lead and built a team in a similar role before
  • Prioritize your mental, physical and emotional health
  • Relentless problem solver. Work well in accelerated, short sprints and are great at removing blockers.
  • Fluent in writing SQL queries
  • Comfortable working using Docker & Kubernetes
  • Well-versed in distributed database systems (PostgreSQL)
  • Values outcomes over inputs — results are what matters
  • Comfortable with Google Cloud ecosystem (BigQuery, DataPrep, Cloud Storage, DataFlow) and server-less computing
  • Solid knowledge of micro-service architecture
  • Can communicate data trends effectively

bonus

  • Familiar with Airflow or Data flow
  • Comfortable using Jupyter notebooks
  • Familiar with Go, TypeScript and Python
  • Familiar with the GCP ecosystem (or GCP certified)
  • Familiar with OLAP systems (like Druid or Clickhouse)
  • Personally interested in what's happening in the creator economy (NFTs, crypto, music and media streaming)
  • Solid understanding of machine learning
  • Understand how to set up a CI/CD pipelines (Google Cloud Build/Github Actions)
  • Passionate or interested in the online content space and web3 finance, in particular, exploring new business models by combining both

pocket-network.name: Pocket Network
pocket-network.content:
Web3 Infrastructure the Right Way - Decentralized

Pocket Network is decentralized API that incentivizes people and companies to run full nodes for any blockchain. This is done through a protocol that connects blockchain developers with full RPC access to the network of nodes.

1382457-devops-tooling-engineer.title: DevOps & Tooling Engineer
1382457-devops-tooling-engineer.description:
About Pocket Network

Pocket Network is the leading decentralized blockchain infrastructure protocol. We are looking for an exceptional DevOps & Infrastructure Tooling Engineer to join our highly-skilled and passionate team.

As an open-source, permissionless protocol, we believe in decentralization and the future of crypto that will enable greater participation in global digital economies and communities. Our mission is to provide permissionless, high-quality infrastructure for blockchains and apps of all sizes.

Pocket is a remote-first organization with offices in Tampa, Florida and the Dominican Republic.

Responsibilities

  • Create monitoring and alerting solutions for critical parts of our highly-available infrastructure
  • Work with app developers and node runners to assist in deployments and troubleshoot issues
  • Architect, design and implement end to end solutions for deployment automation, visibility, high availability and security for Pocket Network infrastructure software
  • Author documentation and guides for infrastructure and tooling that you create
  • Manage and secure automated system backups and disaster recovery infrastructure
  • Implement and/or maintain internal CI/CD components

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Engineering or Software Engineering, or equivalent experience
  • Excellent english communication skills, both written and verbal
  • AWS Solutions / Networking / Security / DevOps certifications or equivalent experience
  • Production-level experience deploying and troubleshooting cloud infrastructure, including monitoring and alerting
  • Docker, Compose, Terraform, Ansible or similar deployment experience
  • Typescript, Golang, Python, Bash or similar programming skills
  • CI/CD (Github Actions) experience

Bonus Qualifications

  • Pocket Network knowledge and/or experience
  • Experience running nodes for blockchains such as Ethereum

Compensation Notes

Final offer will be made based on the abilities, experience and fit of the candidate.

1382469-mid-senior-backend-engineer.title: Mid / Senior Backend Engineer
1382469-mid-senior-backend-engineer.description:
About Pocket Network

Pocket Network is the leading decentralized blockchain infrastructure protocol. We are looking for an exceptional Backend TypeScript Engineer to join our highly-skilled and passionate team.

As an open-source, permissionless protocol, we believe in decentralization and the future of crypto that will enable greater participation in global digital economies and communities. Our mission is to provide permissionless, high-quality infrastructure for blockchains and apps of all sizes.

Pocket is a remote-first organization with offices in Tampa, Florida and the Dominican Republic.

Responsibilities

  • Develop new features for a highly-available and globally-used TypeScript application servicing millions of requests per day
  • Set technical direction for the Pocket Portal product, based on business requirements and user needs
  • Produce relevant technical documentation on any architectural, design or implementation details
  • Help identify and triage issues found in all of our user-facing products

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Engineering or Software Engineering, or equivalent experience
  • Excellent english communication skills, both written and verbal
  • 4+ Years of TypeScript or Golang
  • Postgres / MongoDB / Redis knowledge and experience to know which is the right tool for a specific job
  • Experience building test suites with Nock or similar

Bonus Qualifications

  • Pocket Network knowledge and/or experience
  • Blockchain programming experience such as Solidity or Vyper
  • Distributed systems knowledge such as IPFS
  • CI/CD with Github Actions and AWS

Compensation Notes

Final offer will be made based on the abilities, experience and fit of the candidate. Mid-to-Senior level candidates will be considered.

2028654-protocol-specialist.title: Protocol Specialist
2028654-protocol-specialist.description:
Position Overview

Conceived on the back of the 2017 crypto wave, Pocket Network was borne of a realization. While Infura enabled the ICO boom, it also made it extremely vulnerable due to operating as a single point of failure. A secure, efficient, and censorship-resistant future for Web3 must be enabled by truly decentralized infrastructure, not by centralized platforms gating access to networks.

The pitfalls of Web2 become more obvious by the day - security breaches, gatekeepers, and ever-more aggressive censorship have turned the open-source dream of the free internet into increasingly dystopian surveillance and control system. Pocket Network offers a radical escape: a means to bring the free internet back, only this time it's unstoppable.

Our engineering department currently includes a small stable team – specialists in critical areas, our CTO, and our CEO. We’ve achieved a great deal, but we also understand that “what got you here, won’t get you there”. We will be scaling up the engineering team in 2022 and we want to bring smart people aboard that will help make fulfill the goals and deliver the best platform while ensuring quality.

That’s where you come in: you will be in charge of everyday research, design, and development of new technologies for the Pocket Blockchain Protocol. You will have to drive your progress and propose new ideas and solutions that will make our Protocol faster, leaner, robust, and secure.

You should also be an active member of the Pocket community, you will have to be a leader and role model for community developers that will join the project. You will have the opportunity to do research and present papers that will drive and motivate others to participate in the development of the Blockchain Protocol.

Success will be measured primarily in qualitative terms, which may include but are not limited to: participating in ideation meetings, bringing new ideas to the table and running research to find the best solutions, and implementing those ideas with quality in mind.

Key Projects & Objectives

  • R&D
    • On a daily basis, you will be running research, designing systems, and participating in ideation meetings to bring new solutions to the table
    • Participate in other member's Ideas, by discussing and proposing improvements
    • Help another team member to run research and comparison about different options
    • Write reports and papers about research results
    • Accept suggestions, ideas and help with your research tasks
  • Implementation
    • Protocol level features on GoLang
    • Automated test platforms
    • Debug, setup, and test tooling to help developers and users
    • Code refactoring for improving performance, security, and readability
    • Apply best practices and standard styling
  • Review
    • Code review implementations, comment and suggest improvements
    • Help other team members to unblock their work
    • Participate in projects by providing your best knowledge
    • Review community contributions and help the community participation in the project
  • Role model
    • Participate in community channels, answer questions,s and review projects
    • Follow the contribution guide patterns to be an example for the community
    • Identify improvements and bugs on community forums and GitHub comments

Who We’re Looking For and Why You Should Care

As a mission-driven organization, Pocket Network is a rewarding and engaging place to work for those who embrace our core ethos, which could be distilled as a commitment to results, truth, openness, kindness, stewardship, gratitude, and collaboration. Huge egos need not apply. At Pocket, the best idea wins.

You’ll come from a production environment in software engineering. You’ll probably (but not necessarily) have a DevOps background. What’s most important is that you’re a relentless optimizer and tinkerer, a great systems thinker who can see how pieces of a process fit together, then deconstruct, rebuild and optimize them in order to produce improved outcomes (and test, test, test). You’ll be a skilled practical problem solver who enjoys finding weak links and experimenting with ways to improve them.

You have a deep understanding of Computer Science, Networking, P2P, and preferably GoLang. You’ve been working on related areas like Backend, Infrastructure, and Low-Level library development for the last years. You love to research and design complete systems from scratch, understanding every line of code and maximizing every library and pattern.

As such, while it’s important you have a grounding in a real-world software engineering environment, it’s mindset and attitude we’re looking for more so than any specific tech stack, job title, or level of experience. If you love engineering but wish you could spend less time on the minutiae and more time on building and optimizing a well-oiled software production machine, this might just be exactly the job for you.

Pocket is an idea whose time has come. While the fundamental engineering, product, and revenue infrastructure are in place and product-market fit has been proven, the vast majority of potential and impact lies in the future. For ambitious builders and innovators, there couldn't be a better time to join us. And you’ll get to help us solve one of the most urgent and pressing problems of our time – a generational crisis - by helping us to build secure, censorship-resistant Web3 infrastructure and restore the free and open internet.

2013268-team-lead-backend-engineering.title: Team Lead, Backend Engineering
2013268-team-lead-backend-engineering.description:
About us

Pocket Network is the leading decentralized blockchain infrastructure protocol. This is an opportunity to get in on the ground floor of our quickly growing adoption curve. As an open-source, permissionless protocol driving developer adoption, we believe in a future that will enable greater participation in global digital economies and communities.

Our culture

We are committed to building a fun, inclusive workplace and culture based on our values. Our core values inform how we work together as a team, how we service our users, and how we approach the products we build.

We're looking for open-minded, motivated individuals that want to expand the adoption of Web3. We are a fast moving, collaborative, and free thinking team. We're united by our desire to fully decentralize Web3, build amazing products for our users, and create a diverse and welcoming workplace.

What you'll do

In this role, you will own our Portal application & client SDKs, which are tools that explicitly enable our DApp consumers to send relays (e.g., API requests) to the nearly 40 blockchains our network currently supports. At present, we are re-architecting and refactoring these applications to use Go. You will take full control over executing this migration and final delivery of these products. You will then be responsible for architecting all future features related to these and new products. All of this will be done with a team of 5 engineers who you will have the honor of leading and mentoring.

Lastly, you will be reporting directly to the VP of Engineering and will be a key participant in our decision-making process. This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere in the world, which makes communication a crucial part of the role.

In this role, you will

  • Plan, architect, build and deploy the next-generation of the Portal API, Pocket’s gateway to its distributed network that ingests over 400M requests daily
  • Create or maintain software libraries and programs depended on by other systems currently in production
  • Guide team development efforts towards successful product delivery and maintenance
  • Lead and develop junior engineers, and provide guidance and reviews for open source contributors around the world
  • Collaborate with the Protocol team to design experiments that will inform development efforts around future versions of the Protocol

Preferred qualifications

  • Production level experience developing and maintaining distributed systems at scale
  • Demostrable, extensive experience with Go on globally distributed, concurrent production systems.
  • Experience with TypeScript and Node.js
  • Literacy with cryptographic principles and applications
  • Proven track record of driving projects with a team in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong technical design ability informed by broad experience across multiple domains/specialties
  • Experience leading open source projects, and guiding their communities is a bonus

What we are offering

  • Competitive token vesting package (to be determined upon receiving an offer)
  • Remote work and a flexible work schedule
  • Generous paid time off
  • Healthcare & Benefits

1775959-developer-relations-lead.title: Developer Relations Lead
1775959-developer-relations-lead.description:
Pocket Network is the leading decentralized blockchain infrastructure protocol, with support for dozens of the major Web3 networks and billions of weekly relays.

We are looking for someone who is a Web3 wizard and master communicator who can educate and support our rapidly growing community of DApp Developers and Node Runners.

The ideal candidate operates like many of our Web3 friends do; they’re deeply curious about all corners of Web3, passionate about the principles of open-source, and have an obsessive attention to detail.

Because Pocket Network is chain-agnostic node infrastructure in service of DApp developers, you’ll need to get comfortable with a breathtaking breadth of knowledge – how to build DApps and run nodes for every blockchain, via Pocket Network – and become an inspirational voice for the Web3 ecosystem.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Developer Education – growing docs.pokt.network into the gold-standard source of technical information for the Pocket Network community and wider Web3 ecosystem, producing educational content ranging from written blogs to video tutorials, hosting events such as virtual office hours in Discord and in-person workshops at hackathons
  • Developer Support – working with engineers to triage issues ranging from user error (e.g. inefficient calls to full nodes) to Pocket Network bugs
  • Developer Onboarding – being the point of contact for inbound Portal users and referring high-value developers to our Marketplace team
  • Developer Evangelism – working with our Marketing team to identify content gaps, identifying external Web3 resources that should reference Pocket Network, presenting at conferences and hackathons, collaborating with Web3 developer communities, etc.
  • Scaling – amplifying the impact of the Developer Relations team by adopting effective support processes/tooling, recruiting Developer Relations Engineers, and establishing sustainable working relationships with community contributors

Experience:

  • Experience using an EVM chain as a dev.
  • Experience/curiosity running full nodes.
  • Can deploy, configure and maintain POKT nodes without difficulty.
  • Excellent written communication skills, demonstrable by previous documentation/guides.
  • Excellent orator willing to speak in front of an audience (virtual and/or IRL).
  • Keen organizational abilities with a focus on what’s best for the users.
  • High-performance self-starting operator comfortable in remote-first environments.
  • Can design processes to make distributed working scalable and efficient.

Bonus Points:

  • Experience with other major blockchains or L2 (Solana, Matic(Polygon), Harmony, Avalanche, etc).
  • Experience managing communities.
  • Experience contributing to DAOs.
  • Strong Meme game.

Characteristics:

  • Veracious curiosity for all things Web3 development.
  • Can toggle between leader, teammate, steward, community member.
  • Can toggle between “professional” and “casual” voices.
  • Would be doing this anyway in Web3 communities or, even better, already is.

What we are offering:

  • $100-150k USD Salary + POKT incentive package, depending on experience.
  • Healthcare/Benefits, all that jazz.
  • Flexible work schedule.
  • Opportunities to travel the world and explore digital nomad lifestyles.
  • Training, mentorship, and coaching from anyone in our network.
  • A team that feels like a family.
  • Many challenges to keep you engaged.

1993072-senior-product-manager-infrastru.title: Senior Product Manager (Infrastructure Team)
1993072-senior-product-manager-infrastru.description:
About us

Pocket Network is the leading decentralized blockchain infrastructure protocol. This is an opportunity to get in on the ground floor of our quickly growing adoption curve. As an open-source, permissionless protocol driving developer adoption, we believe in a future that will enable greater participation in global digital economies and communities.

Our culture

We are committed to building a fun, inclusive workplace and culture based on our values. Our core values inform how we work together as a team, how we service our users, and how we approach the products we build.

We're looking for open-minded, motivated individuals that want to expand the adoption of Web3. We are a fast moving, collaborative, and free thinking team. We're united by our desire to fully decentralize Web3, build amazing products for our users, and create a diverse and welcoming workplace.

What you'll do

In this role, you will take full ownership of our existing DevOps internal tools suite. You will be responsible for working with the team to maintain and innovate around these products. You will also work with our business development team, DevOps engineers, community members on prioritizing future blockchain integrations. You will be expected to help foster an environment of experimentation where new internal tools and automation tools will be created. On some occasions, these tools will be open sourced for our community. In these scenarios, you will work with our Developer Relations team to ensure a successful public release and that we adhere to an SLA.

Finally, you will be reporting directly to the VP of Engineering and will be a key participant in our decision-making process that will shape the course of our current and future suite of internal tooling. This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere in the world, which makes communication a crucial part of the role.

In this role, you will

  • Coordinate with the engineering and developer relations teams to accomplish existing automation and tooling objectives
  • Drive future iterations of our existing internal tools
  • Be responsible for defining the scope of development for new internal tooling products and features
  • Actively communicate contingency and mitigation plans for the team

Preferred qualifications

  • Existing experience working in the software industry as product manager
  • Experience with cloud computing platforms, preferably AWS
  • Knowledge of common DevOps tooling and frameworks, such as Docker, Ansible, and Terraform
  • Basic infrastructure understanding of TCP/IP networking and Linux
  • Manage and prioritize the backlogs for multiple products
  • Ability to manage multiple, competing business priorities simultaneously
  • Collaboratively work with the team to create and complete quarterly planning and set OKRs
  • Eager to learn more about the blockchain space. Personal experience playing around in the space is a plus.

What we are offering

  • Competitive token vesting package (to be determined upon receiving an offer)
  • Remote work and a flexible work schedule
  • Generous paid time off
  • Healthcare & Benefits

tally-governance.name: Tally
tally-governance.content:
Collective decision making for decentralized organizations on Ethereum

Tally helps people make collective decisions to govern projects on Ethereum. Our users are people who own DeFi – decentralized finance – governance tokens for projects like Uniswap or Compound. These tokens give them power to vote on how best to improve the project.

1145040-backend-engineer.title: Backend engineer
1145040-backend-engineer.description:
Tally (withtally.com) is hiring a backend & API engineer in the Americas time zone. We are a small team with a big goal: reinventing the way people collaborate on the internet by building tools for DAOs.

Our tools help run decentralized organizations in Web3 and DeFi protocols like Uniswap, ENS and Gitcoin on the Ethereum blockchain. Tally is a product- and engineering-driven startup. We obsess about improving the user experience. To get there, we need to deeply understand the power and limitations of blockchain tech today, and where it's going over the next few years.

We have a culture of teaching and learning from each other. We welcome and value contributions to code, product and process from all members of our team.

Our team is fully remote. We’re based up and down the Americas from Buenos Aires to New York City. Instead of having offices, we have a budget for travel. We do both team retreats and go to big crypto conferences to meet other people in the space and to keep up with all the cool stuff people are doing.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Building a data pipeline in Go
  • Building out an express api in typescript
  • Integrating with blockchain data and other APIs
  • Communicating about requirements and engineering tradeoffs to other members of the team
  • Helping product and design properly scope stories and understand engineering costs
  • Continuously improving internal processes, both API tooling and – more importantly – human processes
  • Reviewing and providing feedback on code written by your colleagues

What we’re looking for:

  • Experience with backend web, API, or data pipeline development
  • Someone who is comfortable owning, building and operating big parts of the app
  • Strong written communicator
  • Gracious teacher
  • Enthusiastic learner

Nice to have:

  • Experience with Go or a similar language
  • Startup experience
  • Experience with ethereum javascript libraries like ethers or web3
  • Understanding of crypto concepts like public-key cryptography, signature aggregation, and Merkle Trees
  • Familiarity with blockchain concepts like transactions, mining, rollups and smart contracts If you aren’t familiar with this stuff, we’d love to teach you!

Benefits:

  • Fully remote company
  • In the US, 401k match and healthcare insurance
  • Equity/stock options
  • Generous and flexible PTO policy
  • Learning budget for books and online classes
  • Home office budget
  • Option to get in paid crypto

To apply, send us a short note about your interest in Tally and a resume!

1869340-devops-and-infrastructure-engine.title: Devops and Infrastructure Engineer
1869340-devops-and-infrastructure-engine.description:
Tally (withtally.com) is hiring a devops & automation engineer in the Americas time zone. We are a small team with a big goal: reinventing the way people collaborate on the internet by building tools for DAOs.

Our tools help run decentralized organizations in Web3 and DeFi protocols like Uniswap, ENS and Gitcoin on the Ethereum blockchain. Tally is a product- and engineering-driven startup. We obsess about improving the user experience. To get there, we need to deeply understand the power and limitations of blockchain tech today, and where it's going over the next few years.

We have a culture of teaching and learning from each other. We welcome and value contributions to code, product and process from all members of our team.

Our team is fully remote. We’re based up and down the Americas from Buenos Aires to New York City. Instead of having offices, we have a budget for travel. We do both team retreats and go to big crypto conferences to meet other people in the space and to keep up with all the cool stuff people are doing.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Operating backend services in Kubernetes running on Google Cloud Platform
  • Building tools to make development and testing easier for the whole engineering team
  • Automating service deployment and scaling

web3api.name: Web3API
web3api.content:
The Universal Web3 Integration Standard

Web3API brings the ease of Web2 to Web3. It aims to make integrating Web3 protocols into apps seamless, without sacrificing decentralization. Web3API accomplishes this through a WASM standard & developer toolchain that streamlines Web3 protocol integrations into applications. All of the logic that used to be bundled into JavaScript SDKs (among other languages), is now within light-weight, secure, and portable WASM modules. Web3API is being built by a group of enthusiastic builders from all around the globe. We believe in an open and decentralized internet, and are coordinating this project entirely through a DAO to ensure these values are retained.

1326441-rust-developer-remote.title: Rust Developer [REMOTE]
1326441-rust-developer-remote.description:
Web3API is seeking a highly skilled and experienced developer to contribute to the tool-chain's fundamental components, focusing on the Rust ecosystem.

About Web3API

Web3API brings the ease of Web2 to Web3. It aims to make integrating Web3 protocols into apps seamless, without sacrificing decentralization.

Web3API accomplishes this through a WASM standard & developer toolchain that streamlines Web3 protocol integrations into applications. All of the logic that used to be bundled into language specific SDKs, is now within light-weight, secure, and portable WASM modules.

To learn more, please see our docs (pre-alpha).

Web3API is being built by a group of enthusiastic builders from all around the globe. We believe in an open and decentralized internet, and are coordinating this project entirely through a DAO to ensure these values are retained.

Job Description

Responsibilities:

  • Work on mission-critical projects with limited/no supervision
  • Play an active role in the design and architecture of Web3API and its surrounding software ecosystem
  • Work remotely with an internationally distributed team
  • Coordinate with various technical partners, ensuring their use-cases are well supported
  • Help author and maintain the Web3API Standard through translating technical details into written specifications

Skills & Qualifications:

If more than three points below describe you, please do reach out:

  • Demonstrated ability to...

    • Publish & maintain production grade software

Commitment Level

Full-Time (Ideal)

Compensation

Payment will be commensurate with experience.

web3labs.name: Web3 Labs
web3labs.content:
Blockchain products for enterprise, open source development and consulting services

Web3 Labs is a leading blockchain technology company. We develop blockchain software and work with companies to help them succeed with blockchain deployments. Our clients include Microsoft, J.P. Morgan, ConsenSys and R3. Our open source blockchain library Web3j has been downloaded nearly 1 million times, and our Epirus Blockchain Explorer is widely used by enterprises for reporting and supporting their blockchain deployments. In 2020, we were a runner up in Microsoft’s Partner of the year awards too.

1785455-web3j-developer.title: Web3j Developer
1785455-web3j-developer.description:
Are you looking for a career in a leading blockchain technology company?

Web3 Labs are the creators of the popular Open-Source Web3j library, downloaded over 1 million times, and used by Java and Android developers for connecting to the Ethereum blockchain. We work with both small and large companies, helping them to succeed with their blockchain deployments.

The companies we’ve worked with have been able to simplify their business processes by harnessing the new trust and transparency models that blockchain technology provides. Our clients include Microsoft, J.P. Morgan, Vodafone, ConsenSys and R3.

Web3 Labs are recognised for the first class services we provide and we were proud to be a runner up in Microsoft’s Partner of the Year Awards, 2020.

Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment? Do you want to be part of an exceptional entrepreneurial team with innovative, motivated and extremely driven people? If this sounds like you, get in touch as we expand for an exciting new project!

You should be a good team player, have great communication skills and be up for solving new problems. Our innovative culture will help you to learn, grow and advance. Our team thrives on shared success and diverse ways of thinking.

If you’re looking for a challenging career working in a supportive, friendly team, this could be the role for you. As part of our team, you'll be working with cutting-edge technologies and will have the opportunity to develop a wide range of new skills on the job.

About the Role

We’re looking for a strong core Java/Kotlin developer interested in bringing best practices to further the development of our Web3j library and tools. You’ll get an opportunity to not just work on highly popular Open-Source software, but also help build cutting edge development tooling. We don’t expect you to have blockchain or Ethereum experience, but a proven interest is a must. This is also a fantastic opportunity to be part of a fast growing company.

As a developer on the Web3 Labs Engineering team, you will be responsible for all things needed to help progress the Web3j library, related tools and documentation. It’s a hands-on role looking for developers who take pride in their work. You will work collaboratively with the rest of the team and community.

This is a remote position - We’re happy to work with people based anywhere in a timezone that overlaps significantly with the UK (Europe, Africa).

Requirements

  • Java or Kotlin, and other related languages - 3+ years
  • Experience with Git (Github, Bitbucket, or similar) - 3+ years
  • Experience with Gradle, Maven, Intellij and other related technologies - 2+ years
  • Proven interest in blockchain technology
  • Proven interest with using or working on Web3 libraries (ethers.js, truffle, web3js, web3j, ..)
  • Ability to work with an agile and remote team

Make yourself stand out!

  • Hands-on experience with peer-to-peer and distributed systems
  • Hands-on experience with Solidity
  • Hands-on experience with Geth, Besu or equivalent
  • Knowledge of inner working of EVM or other blockchains

Life at Web3 Labs

At Web3 Labs, we pride ourselves on having an awesome culture. Don’t just take our word for it, here’s what our staff say:

“We have exposure to books and conferences. It's a cherished culture because blockchain is an area that continues to develop and so we need to keep up with all current developments.”

“It’s an easy going environment - easy to explore solutions independently and easy to speak out and share views. I have autonomy and receive constructive feedback in a positive atmosphere.”

“My job is extremely interesting. I’m surrounded by talented developers who focus on developing clean code and providing good solutions - it’s a true professional culture.”

We want to provide the optimal environment for our staff to work at their very best and understand that we also need to support their own personal needs. That’s why we provide flexibility on working days or hours to fit in with family commitments. We know that life has been pretty challenging for everyone lately and now our company works completely remotely. When life returns ‘normal’ we will meet up in person from time to time and continue to have our amazing team events when possible.
We want our staff to grow their own profile through the company too. We are supportive of OSS work and love it when our staff present at conferences and meetups like Devcon and ConsenSys’ Quorum Webinars. Of course, we sponsor our staff to attend and share their expertise at these events.

As we said above, since COVID-19 we've become a fully remote team. We’re happy to work with people based anywhere in a timezone that overlaps significantly with the UK (Europe, Africa).
Learn more about us!

Our social media presence is ever growing - you can find out more about us here:

  • Web3 Labs Blog
  • Web3 Labs Twitter
  • Web3 Labs YouTube
  • Web3 Labs Podcast - This Week in Blockchain
  • Web3 Labs Podcast - Blockchain Innovators
